title-group.article-title: AGRICULTURAL LOAN RECOVERY STRATEGIES IN A DEVELOPING ECONOMY: A CASE STUDY OF IMO STATE, NIGERIA

abstract.p: Recovery of loans is critical to long-run viability of agricultural credit systems in most developing countries. There exists little understanding of the strategies and considerations lending agencies adopted in dealing with the problem. Thus, this paper provides some empirical evidence on loan recovery strategies of agricultural lending agencies in Imo State, Nigeria. It shows that both formal and informal lending agencies strive to deal with the defaulters in what they perceive as the most cost-effective way (s). Adoption of any strategy depends on a complex interaction of factors on the demand and supply sides of credit. These suggest that the lender, the borrower, and the socio-political factors must taken into consideration in planning effective loan recovery strategies in developing countries.
